page.title: 03DUDLEY CARNIVALS
page.content: Local{carnivals}and fairs abound throughout the year with schools and churches and numerous organisations taking part. These are often preceeded by a{procession}of colourful floats and a previously elected carnival queen. The staging of{Black Country {markets,}often held in the evening is a custom that has recently been revived and is extremely popular. {Sunday School anniversaries}and procession led by the band of a local organisation followed by church or chapel services, an important feature of which is the carefully rehearsed singing of the children, abound. The girls are often dressed in white dresses and the boys in white shirts and are seated on a platform.
